{"step_by_step_thinking": "Maraviroc is a CCR5 antagonist that interferes with HIV binding at the stage of co-receptor engagement. It is used in the treatment of HIV infection. The tropism assay is performed to ensure that the patient is only harboring R5 viruses. Therefore, the receptor affected by the use of maraviroc is not gp120, gp160, p24, or reverse transcriptase.", "answer_choice": "None of the above"}
